title: Probability
text: We know the mean is $$147$$ emails, and we are looking for the probability that the email user receives exactly $$160$$ emails per day. Use this information for a calculator procedure.
speech: We know the mean is  147  emails, and we are looking for the probability that the email user receives exactly  160,  emails per day. Use this information for a calculator procedure.
pacedSpeech: emails, and we are looking for the probability that the email user receives exactly   160,
emails per day. Use this information for a calculator procedure.

title: Calculator
text: $$P(x=160)=poissonpdf(147,160)$$. Put this into the calculator to get the answer. poissonpdf is being used because we are finding the probability of an exact value, rather than a range.
speech: p, parentheses, x is equal to 160,  is equal to poissonpdf of, parentheses 147 comma 160,  . Put this into the calculator to get the answer. poissonpdf is being used because we are finding the probability of an exact value, rather than a range.

title: Calculator
text: Calculator steps: press 2nd DISTR, arrow down to poissonpdf. Press ENTER. Enter $$(147,160)$$.
